name: Holiday Inn Nice

reviews.text: I had booked 5 rooms from 10-12th April for business and pleasure, and it could not have been better! The hotel is situated in the centre of Nice.
reviews.title: Excellent stay all around, thank you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you so much Antoinette and Marianne for excellent customer service. After a very early morning flight and a very warm welcome, my group went for lunch, all the shops and restaurants less than 5 mins walk away.
reviews.title: as good as ever
Good Hotel With Excellent Staff
reviews.text: Very good Executive sized rooms overlooking Nice on the 6th floor, very comfortable beds (essential!!) with all the necessary hotel toiletry goodies, flat screen TV's, tea and coffee facilities, and in-room safes. Breakfast was good with hot and cold buffet. Very clean hotel and good customer friendly staff, if you want anything just ask. Good recommendations for restaurants, try Flos', a converted theatre, looks fabulous (didn't actually eat there, but I will be returning soon to try it).

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Overall we had a wonderful but brief 2 night stay with my girlfriend, we went on to Paris after.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will be returning to see more of Nice and Monte Carlo and stay in the Holiday Inn Nice (with my wife to be!!) to enjoy this wonderful part of South of France!
reviews.title: Quality...will visit again

reviews.text: I needed to go the Nice, France on a business trip and my husband decided to join me. The more we read about French hotels, the more worried we became. It seemed as if there is no such thing as a non-smoking room in France (ditto for many other European cities). This Holiday Inn actually DOES have non-smoking rooms. We requested one when we made our reservations and when we arrived (nice check in) we went to our assigned room. The room itself was fine, but smelled horribly of stale cigarette smoke. The two of us were exhausted from our flight and just wanted to get some sleep. Even the beds smelled. I went back down to the reception area to ask to be put in another room. Initially, there was some reluctance -- "We arranged this room just for you. This is a special room...It will be inconvenient to move you at this time" I stuck to my guns. They gave us another room on another floor and it was heaven. Honestly, this switch saved our trip. --All the other reviewer's' comments about cleanliness and the bed comfort, etc are true. Our breakfast was included in our stay and the chocolate croissants were the best I've ever had. The location is great too. It's in a quieter area but close enough to walk to everything w/o much bother. If we were ever to return, we will come back to this hotel. I'm not sure what happened with our original hotel room and why we were placed in this room, but in the end it all worked out. Had this not occured I'd rate this establishment a "5". It's a clean, Holiday Inn in a great location and the hotel actually does have smoke-free rooms.
reviews.title: They have Non-smoking rooms!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 night. Paid approx £400 for myself and my wife in an executive room. Location was excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: My only advice in do not eat here as breakfast is 18 euros per person and it is much cheaper if you walk into the centre which is only 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

reviews.text: Parking is no problem as there is a car park below but you will pay 16 euros for 24 hours. Thes best thing to do is try park on the road which after 18:00 is free.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel Lovely location

reviews.text: Much enjoyed trip all round. You will not be dissopointed
reviews.title: Central location

reviews.text: Stayed overnight with Globus tour. I loved the location. Only a 10 minute walk to beach and casino. Spent several hours at the sidewalk cafes and shops. Staff was helpful and friendly. One of the best rooms we stayed in out of 11 on the tour.
reviews.title: Stayed with Globus tour

reviews.text: Booked this hotel for a short break of two nights before looking at tripadvisor because of the good rates and proximity to the old town. However, we were more than pleased to find that it was in a very smart street, surrounded by smart up-market shops, residences, etc. The service was excellent, we were upgraded without being told from a standard to an executive room (probably because the hotel was very quiet and it makes good marketing sense since we will probably go back!). Staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the hotel was spotless.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent service!
Just returned from the Holiday Inn
reviews.text: The only downside, though not a very important one, was that the restaurant was closed in the evening, though food could be ordered and eaten in the bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Location!!

reviews.text: Thanks to your contributors we decided, as two oldies, to stay at the Holiday Inn. We had one of their executive rooms which was spotless and roomy for France. Although the view was of the main road (Victor Hugo) the noise was minimal with the window closed. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The only problem we encountered was some difficulty at breakfast when coach parties arrived. They seemed to eat early and clear everything from the buffet. The staff did their best to replenish the food but it was much nicer when it was quieter.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.text: The hotel was in an extremely good central position and we walked to the bus station and the railway station without any effort. The old town was also near enough to walk into at night to eat. Altogether a very good hotel and holiday. Lee
reviews.title: Good hotel - value for money

description: Located in the very heart of Nice, in a residential area, a few minutes ago from the seafront, the interesting sights and the main shopping zone. Access: International airport 7 kms, Train station 300 m. Totally refurbished in 2012! Rooms: spacious, modern and lighted, air conditioned and sound proved; marble bathrooms with hair dryer. Tea and coffee maker, satellite LCD TV and pay TV, ADSL Wifi, direct phone, electronic safety box, minibar, pillow list; Restaurant "Chez Panisse" and cocktail bar, gym center.
